article_text: In an election year, candidates are holding forth predictably about finding solutions to persistent problems, fixing ineffective programs and even—at last—meeting the needs of the American people. William G. Howell and Terry M. Moe, professors at the University of Chicago and Stanford University, respectively, think that a change in the very structure of American government is needed before any such promises can be kept. The thesis of “Relic” is that the United States is “burdened with a government designed for a bygone era.”...

twitter.description: Thomas J. Main reviews “Relic: How Our Constitution Undermines Effective Government—and Why We Need a More Powerful Presidency” by William G. Howell and Terry M. Moe.
twitter.title: America Needs a Prime Minister

article_metadata.author: Thomas J. Main

article_summary:
The thesis of “Relic” is that the United States is “burdened with a government designed for a bygone era.”...
In an election year, candidates are holding forth predictably about finding solutions to persistent problems, fixing ineffective programs and even—at last—meeting the needs of the American people.
William G. Howell and Terry M. Moe, professors at the University of Chicago and Stanford University, respectively, think that a change in the very structure of American government is needed before any such promises can be kept.
